hero.name: Cyan Thayn
hero.intro: Hi, I’m Cyan! Online I go by AnalogCyan. I build playful tools, fix broken tech, and chase weird ideas across the stack. Learn more

meta.description: Cyan Thayn's personal website showcasing her projects and interests.

about.title: About
about.intro: Hi, I’m Cyan. Online, I go by AnalogCyan. I use she/her pronouns, and I am proudly neurodivergent. My brain tends to take its own path, and I appreciate your patience when it does.
about.body1: You can usually find me programming, tinkering with gadgets, or chasing whatever idea has captured my attention. I am drawn to novelty and a bit of whimsy, especially tactile, slightly imperfect tech that feels intentional and full of character.
about.body2: If you would like to see what I am working on or listening to, explore the site or follow the links below to find me elsewhere online.

projects.intro: Explore some of the projects I've created or contributed to; click on any to learn more! For code-related projects, visit my GitHub; for non-code projects, explore around my site! I'm also a part of Jonnil Games, where I manage the website and help make games. Unless otherwise noted, code on this website is licensed under AGPLv3 and content is licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0.

asylum.title: Juni's Asylum
asylum.desc: A horror adventure game with platforming, puzzles, and branching narrative. Made by Jonnil Games.

sticky.title: Sticky Paws
sticky.desc: A 2D platformer game about a cat that can climb anything! Made by Jonnil Games.

dor.title: DNS-over-RNG
dor.desc: A very cursed DNS server implementation inspired by the various DNS-over-protocol standards.

mobs.title: More Vanilla Mobs
mobs.desc: Minecraft 1.17+ data pack that implements some of the mobs that technically exist in the game, but don't appear in survival.

photos.title: Photos
photos.body: A space for photo sets, experiments, and visual notes. I’ll be adding galleries and highlights here soon.
photos.prompt: Want a peek in the meantime?

music.title: Music
music.body: You can find me on a variety of music related platforms. Not every profile is up-to-date, but they are all collected here for the sake of completeness.
music.body2: For a live look at what is actually in rotation, the Last.fm widget at the top of the page mirrors my current listening activity from my library and links directly to my profile there.
music.prompt: In the meantime, here are my music profiles:
music.clientsBody: I host my personal music library on Valkyrie, my homelab server, using Navidrome.
music.clientsBody2: Every album I care about lives there in full quality, properly tagged, with artwork and metadata exactly how I want it. I prefer owning my music instead of renting access to it. Streaming is convenient, but it is not the same thing as control. When you self host, your library is yours. It works offline, does not get pulled because of licensing changes, and does not change unless you decide to change it.
music.clientsBody3: If that approach appeals to you, it is more approachable than it sounds. All you really need are your files, a small server or spare machine, and the right client apps to access your collection from anywhere.
music.clientsLead: These are the clients I recommend:

lastfmCapsule.title: Last.fm
lastfmCapsule.idleBody: Not currently scrobbling. Here is the latest activity.
lastfmCapsule.errorBody: Could not load Last.fm right now. Try again in a bit.
lastfmCapsule.noData: No recent listening data available right now.

footer.quote: Are you ready to embrace uncertainty?
